text: Pagosa Springs Medical Center is a critical access hospital in Pagosa Springs, Colorado, in Archuleta County. The hospital has 11 beds. It is a Level IV trauma center. ==History== The medical center is a special district hospital serving all of Archuleta County and the parts of Hinsdale and Mineral counties that are south of the continental divide. The special district was formed in 1981, and the current hospital building opened in early 2008. ==References== ==External links== *Hospital website Category:Hospitals in Colorado Category:Buildings and structures in Archuleta County, Colorado Category:Hospitals established in 1981 Category:1981 establishments in Colorado
